description: Borrowed from New Latin eclampsia, from French éclampsie, from Ancient Greek ἔκλᾰμψῐς (éklampsis, “sudden development, violent onset”, literally “brightness”), from ἐκλᾰ́μπω (eklámpō, “to shine or beam forth; to burst forth violently”) +‎ -σῐς (-sis, nominal suffix).

entries.meaning: (pathology) A complication of pregnancy characterized by seizures and coma due to hypertension.
